title: Tom Yum Noodle Soup
source: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
categories: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
ingredients: 4stalks lemongrass, prepared (see this page) and cleaned and bruised
2quarts homemade Chicken Stock or low-sodium canned chicken stock or broth
2medium shallots, cut into large dice, plus 4 shallots, quartered
6fresh kaffir lime leaves, left whole and bruised
3tablespoons Squid Brand fish sauce, plus more to taste
3scallions (green parts only), thinly sliced, for garnish
directions: 1. Prepare the broth: Combine the lemongrass, galangal, and cilantro root in a large stockpot, add the stock, and bring to a boil. Add the chili jam, diced shallots, kaffir lime leaves, and coconut milk and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from the heat, add the fish sauce, and sugar to taste, cover, and let steep for 15 minutes. Strain into a clean pot.

2. Finish the soup: Bring 1 cup of water to a boil in a large high-sided sauté pan over high heat. Add the pork, breaking it up into small pieces with a wooden spoon. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes, until completely cooked. Drain the pork into a colander and transfer to a bowl. Add the fish sauce and stir to combine. Let cool.
3. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add the noodles, and cook for 20 seconds. Drain.
4. Bring the broth to a simmer over medium heat. Add the fish balls, tomatoes, and shallots. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the cooked pork and remove from the heat.

5. To serve: Divide the noodles among 4 to 6 large bowls. Ladle the broth and all of its components over the noodles. Garnish with the cilantro leaves, crispy garlic, and scallions. Add lime juice to taste and additional fish sauce, if needed.
